decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly putting large creatures into play from the graveyard using reanimation spells like Reanimate, Exhume, and Animate Dead. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Thoughtseize, Unmask, and Cabal Therapy to control the opponent's hand. The main win condition is to bring out powerful creatures like Griselbrand, Archon of Cruelty, and Atraxa, Grand Unifier to overwhelm the opponent. The deck uses acceleration like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal to quickly reanimate creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this Dragon Stompy deck is disruption and aggression through the use of cards like Blood Moon, Chalice of the Void, and Magus of the Moon to disrupt the opponent's mana base and game plan. The deck aims to quickly deploy threats like Broadside Bombardiers and Pyrogoyf, supported by cards like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide for fast mana acceleration. Additionally, cards like Fury and Sundering Eruption provide removal options while The One Ring and Urza's Saga provide additional powerful win conditions. This deck aims to close out games quickly and punish opponents for playing non-basic lands.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with a mix of control and tempo cards like Daze, Thoughtseize, and Force of Will while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Murktide Regent and Nethergoyf. The deck also utilizes Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to draw cards and control the board. The mana base is designed to support the deck's game plan with fetch lands and various dual lands. Overall, this deck aims to keep the opponent on their back foot while constantly applying pressure to secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on assembling the Doomsday combo to win the game. By using cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal to generate mana quickly, the player can cast Doomsday, stack their library in a specific order, and win the game with Thassa's Oracle. The deck also includes disruption elements like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Murktide Regent provide card advantage and threats on the board, while cards like Edge of Autumn and Quantum Riddler help with card selection and filtering.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly deploy artifact creatures and utilize artifact synergy to overwhelm the opponent. By running powerful artifact spells like Urza's Bauble and Mox Opal, along with efficient creatures like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Kappa Cannoneer, the deck aims to establish an early board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Chalice of the Void and Pithing Needle. Urza's Saga provides additional value by tutoring for key artifacts, while Force of Will offers protection against opposing threats. With a focus on aggressive plays and artifact-based synergies, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively play powerful Eldrazi creatures as early as possible. By utilizing cards like Chalice of the Void to disrupt the opponent's strategy and Cavern of Souls to ensure the Eldrazi can't be countered, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with high-impact creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer. Additionally, the deck includes mana acceleration with cards like Grim Monolith and Lotus Petal to allow for quicker deployment of threats. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Wasteland and Anticausal Vestige to further hinder the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a mix of creatures and removal spells to control the board. It utilizes efficient creatures like Orcish Bowmasters and Amped Raptor to quickly deal damage to the opponent while also using powerful cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Guide of Souls for additional reach and threats. Cabal Therapy is included to disrupt the opponent's hand, while cards like Thoughtseize and Swords to Plowshares provide additional removal options. The deck also runs a variety of lands to ensure consistency and to support the deck's three-color mana base.

This deck focuses on utilizing the combo between Show and Tell and Sneak Attack to quickly put powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play. The deck also includes cards like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Omniscience to generate additional value and control the game. The deck runs a suite of cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm, along with disruption like Force of Will to ensure the combo pieces come together smoothly. By efficiently ramping into big threats and controlling the board, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win the game quickly.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to aggressively play powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer, supported by cards like Chalice of the Void and Kozilek's Command to disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck also includes various mana acceleration sources like Ancient Tomb and Lotus Petal to quickly cast high-cost Eldrazi creatures. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Wasteland and It That Heralds the End allows for resource denial and additional threats to overwhelm opponents. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents with its powerful creatures and disruptive elements.

This deck is focused on using a combination of fast mana sources and disruptive spells to quickly assemble a powerful combo utilizing cards like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer to mill the entire deck and win the game with Thassa's Oracle. The deck aims to win the game in a single explosive turn while protecting its combo pieces with cards like Pact of Negation and Duress. By effectively managing resources and timing, the deck can consistently execute its game plan and outpace opponents in Legacy 1 vs 1 formats.

This Dimir Tempo deck focuses on utilizing disruptive spells and efficient creatures to apply pressure on the opponent while controlling the board. The deck runs a suite of powerful hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach. It also includes countermagic such as Daze and Force of Will to protect its threats. The deck utilizes efficient removal like Fatal Push and combines it with versatile threats like Murktide Regent and Brazen Borrower to close out games quickly. Additionally, the deck includes Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student for card advantage and Baleful Strix for additional value.

This mono black aggro deck focuses on early disruption and aggression, aiming to quickly pressure opponents and disrupt their strategies. With a combination of powerful creatures like Barrowgoyf and Dauthi Voidwalker, alongside efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize, the deck aims to control the game while dealing consistent damage. Dark Ritual provides mana acceleration to get ahead early, while cards like Sheoldred's Edict and Fell the Profane punish opponents for overextending. The deck also includes graveyard hate with Nihil Spellbomb and versatile threats like Mai, Scornful Striker to keep opponents on edge.

The deck focuses on casting as many spells as possible in a single turn to build up storm count and then finishing the game with Tendrils of Agony. It includes a variety of fast mana sources, card draw spells, and hand disruption to help set up the combo. Burning Wish is used to tutor for specific silver bullet cards from the sideboard, while Song of Creation can provide additional card advantage. The deck aims to win quickly and explosively before the opponent has a chance to develop their own game plan.

The deck aims to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb to cast Omniscience and cheat out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn with Show and Tell. Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Yggdrasil, Rebirth Engine provide additional value and protection for the combo. The deck also includes card draw and counterspells like Force of Will to ensure it can assemble its combo pieces efficiently and protect them from disruption. The goal is to overwhelm opponents with powerful threats and win the game before they can respond effectively.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the Doomsday combo to win the game. It includes efficient card selection and draw spells such as Ponder and Brainstorm, along with disruption in the form of Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo. The win condition is Thassa's Oracle or Jace, Wielder of Mysteries, with back up from Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Quantum Riddler for card advantage. The deck also includes Barrowgoyf as a potential alternative win condition. Overall, the goal is to set up the combo as quickly and efficiently as possible while protecting it from opponent's disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo pieces, Show and Tell and Omniscience, to cheat out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Atraxa, Grand Unifier onto the battlefield for free. This deck utilizes card draw and manipulation spells like Ponder, Brainstorm, and Veil of Summer to find the combo pieces efficiently. The Lotus Petal provides additional mana acceleration to help cast the high-cost creatures, while protection spells like Force of Will are included to protect the combo. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and win the game quickly.
